name: Overview
data: [{"id":"1a999494-af05-4129-bed6-acb1eb1d6269","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Documentation: Symbol Definition & Parameter Management","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4408dc93-ecf6-4aed-b1ee-f58c2b15e721","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This group represents the \"memory\" of the scope. It is responsible for tracking every named entity (variables, functions, classes) and managing the complex relationship between function parameters and the data that flows into them.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"118afaef-2f98-4526-91af-1e83afbd1244","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Introduction","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8a89fd50-8a9a-488f-ad70-268aec562eb3","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Symbol Definition & Parameter Management","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" group acts as the local symbol table for the analyzer. In Python, a scope is more than just a container; it is a dynamic environment where names are bound to values, and multiple execution paths (like if-else branches) can cause a single name to point to various potential objects. This group provides the logic to register these names, retrieve them, and—critically—merge information from different branches to ensure the analysis remains sound.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"603a80c9-3439-4bfb-b04d-ba1342d20dd8","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"How It Works","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f8b170fa-3323-41b0-9ff5-74054c70b26a","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"These methods handle the lifecycle of \"Definitions\" (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"defi","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" objects) within the scope:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"91402eb5-25af-44c4-89dd-de9a7a1669a4","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Definition Storage:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Methods like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"add_def","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get_def","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" manage the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"self.defs","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" dictionary. This is the primary storage for local variables.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6d9b985c-79b4-4efe-90e9-8b07d493242e","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Flow Sensitivity:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"merge_def","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" method is vital for branch analysis. If a variable ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"x","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is defined in both an ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"if","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" block and an ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"else","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" block, ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"merge_def","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" combines the \"points-to\" sets (the possible values) from both paths into a single definition.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"119de379-9942-42bf-a625-8a7fa5b4e31a","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Parameter Mapping:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Functions and methods use ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"add_params","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get_params_defiNs","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to bridge the gap between the caller and the callee. This allows the analyzer to track how an object passed as an argument becomes a local variable within the new scope.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"704a4e8a-7497-4ecc-82a5-6682ee0d2f17","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Namespace Filtering:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get_prefix_defi","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" allows the analyzer to find all definitions that belong to a certain sub-hierarchy, which is essential when dealing with nested attributes or modules.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b545b66e-83bd-452c-80d8-fefc0a8b398c","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Reasoning","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"5df7d3d7-1eb4-41fc-8113-03bd18605eea","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Precision and Soundness:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" By using ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"merge_def","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" instead of simple overwriting, the analyzer avoids losing information about potential variable values, which is necessary for identifying all possible bugs or behaviors.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c5a39b7a-604a-4dce-ad55-26ae354c2350","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Inter-procedural Analysis:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Separating ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"params","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" from general ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"defs","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" allows the analyzer to specifically track the \"interface\" of a function, making it easier to simulate function calls and return values accurately.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"62fa1fb7-2978-464f-9054-40be29361cb6","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Scalability:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" The prefix-based lookup and dictionary-based storage allow the analyzer to quickly locate symbols even in large files with hundreds of definitions.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6e539f1b-3ad1-4141-8e19-8f3041a75ce3","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"73b9778b-6561-4b60-927e-da8c28d0617d","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Method a name to a definition object. If the name already exists, it is updated to reflect the most recent assignment.","styles":{}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}}]},{"cells":[{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"get_defs","styles":{"code":true}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}},{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Provides access to the entire local environment, allowing the analyzer to iterate over all symbols defined in this specific block.","styles":{}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}}]},{"cells":[{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"get_def","styles":{"code":true}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}},{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Performs a targeted lookup for a single name. It returns ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"None","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" if the name is not found locally, signaling that the analyzer may need to check the parent scope.","styles":{}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}}]},{"cells":[{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"merge_def","styles":{"code":true}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}},{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Joins the \"points-to\" sets of two definitions. This ensures that a variable reflects all possible values it could hold across different execution paths.","styles":{}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}}]},{"cells":[{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"get_prefix_defi","styles":{"code":true}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}},{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Filters definitions based on a string prefix. This is commonly used to resolve all members of a class or all variables within a specific sub-namespace.","styles":{}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}}]},{"cells":[{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"add_params","styles":{"code":true}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}},{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Specifically flags a definition as an input parameter, ensuring it is treated as part of the scope's signature for function call analysis.","styles":{}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}}]},{"cells":[{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"get_params_defiNs","styles":{"code":true}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}},{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Resolves complex parameter definitions into their underlying namespace strings, filtering out simple name definitions to focus on concrete object flows.","styles":{}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}}]},{"cells":[{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"add_inputs","styles":{"code":true}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}},{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Records
